citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During a routine review of animal records performed by the IACUC, it was noted that there was a deviation of the protocol.
Under Protocol A3, five pigs were sedated with ketamine and buprenorphine regular during the procedure but did not
receive a fentanyl patch. According to the protocol, when buprenorphine regular is administered a fentanyl patch is
required for the recovery period.
During the Spring 2023 semiannual program review, IACUC members identified a pig that received 1mg/kg of a ketamine
bolus. Under protocol B1, the pig should have received 10-40mg/kg of a ketamine bolus.
Proposed activities and proposed significant changes in ongoing activities that have been approved by the IACUC may be
subject to further appropriate review and approval by officials of the research facility. However, those officials may not
approve an activity involving the care and use of animals if it has not been approved by the IACUC.
This has been corrected by the IACUC through a corrective action plan and protocol amendment.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.

2.31(d)(8) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
During a routine review of animal records performed by the IACUC, it was noted that there was a deviation of the protocol.  
Under Protocol A3, five pigs were sedated with ketamine and buprenorphine regular during the procedure but did not 
receive a fentanyl patch.  According to the protocol, when buprenorphine regular is administered a fentanyl patch is 
required for the recovery period.   
 
During the Spring 2023 semiannual program review, IACUC members identified a pig that received 1mg/kg of a ketamine 
bolus.  Under protocol B1, the pig should have received 10-40mg/kg of a ketamine bolus. 
 
Proposed activities and proposed significant changes in ongoing activities that have been approved by the IACUC may be 
subject to further appropriate review and approval by officials of the research facility.  However, those officials may not 
approve an activity involving the care and use of animals if it has not been approved by the IACUC.  
 
This has been corrected by the IACUC through a corrective action plan and protocol amendment.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
